item.title: England 2-0 Germany: England end 55-year wait for knockout win over Germany
item.description: England end a 55-year wait for a knockout tie victory over Germany to reach the quarter-finals of the European Championship.

item.title: In pictures: England fans celebrate
item.description: Some 40,000 fans inside Wembley stadium cheered as England beat Germany 2-0 in their last-16 clash.

item.title: Euro 2020: Sweden 1-2 Ukraine (AET): England to face Ukraine in quarter-finals
item.description: Artem Dovbyk nets a last-gasp header in extra-time as Ukraine beat 10-man Sweden 2-1 to set up a Euro 2020 quarter-final with England.

item.title: Sgt Matt Ratana shooting: Man charged with murdering police officer
item.description: The man accused of murdering Sgt Matt Ratana can now be charged after spending months in hospital.

item.title: Brewdog: Watchdog urged to probe solid gold can prize claim
item.description: The brewery company could be in hot water as winners dispute the value of the "solid gold" beer cans.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Serena Williams retires injured against Aliaksandra Sasnovich
item.description: American great Serena Williams breaks down in tears as her latest attempt for an elusive record-equalling 24th Grand Slam title is cruelly ended by injury.

item.title: Canada weather: Dozens dead as heatwave shatters records
item.description: The temperature in Lytton, British Columbia, has soared to 47.9C (118.2F).

item.title: Covid death rate 25% higher in Greater Manchester - report
item.description: Life expectancy declined more in the North West in 2020 than in England overall, a report finds.

item.title: Portugal exempts under-18s from quarantine
item.description: But they must be travelling with a fully vaccinated parent or guardian, say tourism authorities.

item.title: Trials of Army's new armoured vehicles halted again
item.description: Testing was previously halted after complaints crews had temporary hearing loss and aching joints.

item.title: Scotland's public health minister tests positive for Covid
item.description: SNP MSP Maree Todd is self-isolating after a positive test but says she has no symptoms.

item.title: Miami building collapse: Letter in April warned of worsening damage
item.description: Residents of an apartment block that collapsed last week were warned of worsening structural damage.

item.title: Brexit: EU to postpone ban on British meat sales in NI
item.description: It comes as a judgement is due in a court challenge to the lawfulness of the NI Protocol.

item.title: The Papers: 'Three Lions Thump Old Enemy' and 'Time to Dream'
item.description: Wednesday's papers mark England reaching the Euro 2020 quarter-finals after a knockout win over Germany.

item.title: Scottish teen hero on holiday rescues sinking dog
item.description: Charlie the shih tzu was sinking in a lake when rescuer Connor Telfer jumped in to save him.

item.title: Self-isolating students in end-of-tenancy 'nightmare'
item.description: What happens if a housemate tests positive for Covid just as you were about to move out?

item.title: Love Island: Megan Barton-Hanson wants a more diverse cast
item.description: Former Love Island contestant Megan Barton-Hanson says she wants to see more diversity in this year's show.

item.title: Canada heatwave: Bears take a dip in record breaking temperatures
item.description: Three mischievous bears have a pool day as Canada reaches record breaking temperatures in British Columbia.

item.title: Your Scotland sunset pictures
item.description: A selection of readers' photographs of Monday's stunning sunset.

item.title: Australian farmer spreads joy with colourful rescue lambs
item.description: Australian farmer Tracey Kruger spreads joy with pictures of her rescue lambs in colourful outfits.

item.title: Inside India's deadly mucormycosis fungus epidemic
item.description: BBC correspondent Yogita Limaye visits a ward battling India's mucormycosis epidemic in the wake of Covid.

item.title: The precarious life of a Gaza fisherman
item.description: Fishermen in Gaza eke out a precarious living amid restrictions over where they can cast their nets.

item.title: Mother's plea after daughter dies swallowing button battery
item.description: Harper-Lee Fanthorpe died in Stoke-on-Trent in May after swallowing a battery from a remote control.

item.title: Marr on catching Covid after being double vaccinated
item.description: The BBC's Andrew Marr fell ill with Covid-19, despite being vaccinated twice.

item.title: Miami building collapse: What could have caused it?
item.description: The search for survivors continues but experts must now piece together what caused a Miami apartment block to collapse.

item.title: Spanish school students stuck in hotel quarantine in Majorca
item.description: An outbreak linked to end-of-year trips to Majorca prompts authorities to isolate the teenagers.

item.title: British Jews' fear and defiance amid record monthly anti-Semitism reports
item.description: Some 460 anti-Semitic incidents were reported to the Community Security Trust from 8 May to 7 June.

item.title: Delivery text scams and how to deal with them
item.description: Some 61% of us have had a fake text from a "delivery driver" over the past year, research shows.

item.title: Covid: Parents 'were treated like criminals' as their son lay dying
item.description: Ollie Bibby's parents are "livid" that Matt Hancock broke rules that they were forced to observe.

item.title: 377: The British colonial law that left an anti-LGBTQ legacy in Asia
item.description: Created by the British, 377 has had a widespread damaging effect in former colonies, say activists.

item.title: Why small investors are piling into share-trading apps
item.description: A boom in cheaper trading is tempting some inexperienced investors to take big risks, warn experts.

item.title: A Pride symbol vandalised in Canada's 'prettiest little town'
item.description: A rainbow pedestrian crossing in Paris, Ontario was vandalised, and the town rallied to fix it.

item.title: 'Holiday food poisoning left me paralysed'
item.description: Malcolm Brown developed a rare autoimmune disease after suffering food poisoning while on a self-catering trip.

item.title: Euro 2020 England v Germany: Harry Kane & Raheem Sterling goals see England through to quarter-finals
item.description: Watch highlights from Wembley as goals from Raheem Sterling and Harry Kane see England beat Germany 2-0.

item.title: Euro 2020: 'The stuff of dreams' - BBC pundits celebrate wildly as England score against Germany
item.description: The pundits launch into a frenzy after England score against Germany, with Rio Ferdinand claiming that the 2-0 England victory is "the stuff of dreams".

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Roger Federer, Dan Evans and Coco Gauff in best of day two
item.description: Watch some of the best moments from day two at Wimbledon as Dan Evans wins and Coco Gauff slips and slides around court before reaching the second round.

item.title: Euro 2020: Artem Dovbyk's late header Gives Ukraine extra-time victory over Sweden
item.description: Ukraine will play England in the Euro 2020 quarter-finals after substitute Artem Dovbyk scores late in the second-half of extra time to secure a 2-1 win over Sweden in Glasgow.

item.title: Federer avoids Wimbledon upset as Mannarino retires injured
item.description: Eight-time champion Roger Federer avoids a huge Wimbledon upset as injury robs France's Adrian Mannarino of the chance to earn a memorable win.

item.title: Root guides England to win in first ODI against Sri Lanka
item.description: Joe Root's 79 not out guides England to a five-wicket win over Sri Lanka in the first one-day international at Emirates Riverside.

item.title: England 2-0 Germany: Who stands between Three Lions and Euro 2020 final?
item.description: England are now favourites to reach the final of the Euros. Here's who they could face along the way.

item.title: Euro 2020: England beat Germany - Harry Kane targets return to Wembley final
item.description: Harry Kane says England's players have a vision of where they want to go after reaching the Euro 2020 quarter-finals by beating Germany 2-0.

item.title: How you rated England's players in win over Germany
item.description: England beat Germany in a historic last-16 Euro 2020 tie at Wembley - here is how you rated the players.

item.title: Euro 2020 England v Germany: Harry Kane doubles England lead over Germany
item.description: Captain Harry Kane extends England's lead to 2-0 after a low header beats Germany's Manuel Neuer in their last-16 Euro 2020 fixture at Wembley.

item.title: Euro 2020 England v Germany: How Three Lions became the definitive England song
item.description: Ever-hopeful England fans have been screaming that "football's coming home" for 25 years.

item.title: Two games, 14 goals, one giant-killing: The best day in Euros history?
item.description: Was 'Magic Monday' the greatest day in European Championship history?

item.title: Euro 2020: England's Bukayo Saka on GCSE grades, golf and Germany
item.description: England's Bukayo Saka tells Kelly Somers about his superb start with England at Euro 2020, his outstanding GCSE grades and his struggles to hit a golf ball.

item.title: Euro 2020 quarter-final fixtures, TV guide & route to the final
item.description: All you need to know from Euro 2020, who faces who in the quarter-finals, plus when and where to watch the games.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: There is 'no reason' for England's final Covid restrictions to last beyond 19 July, the government says.

item.title: What are the rules about self-isolating, testing and masks in schools?
item.description: Entire classes are having to self-isolate because another pupil has tested positive for Covid.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Covid rules are making things a bit different for Euro 2020 spectators.

item.title: Covid: What refund rights are there for holidays abroad?
item.description: What rights do you have if your holidays plans or rules change?

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or coverings?
item.description: Wearing a face covering is currently a legal requirement in many places, but rules are under review.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Over-18s can get a first jab in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, and second jabs are being brought forward.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
item.description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.

item.title: Gary Allen: The killer who nearly got away with murder
item.description: Gary Allen's conviction for the murders of two women brings a 20-year quest for justice to an end.

item.title: The Lazarus heist: How North Korea almost pulled off a billion-dollar hack
item.description: In 2016 North Korean hackers planned a $1bn raid on Bangladesh's national bank and came within an inch of success. But how did they do it?
